long_desc.thetext:
Latest upstream release: 1.11
Current version/release in Fedora Rawhide: 1.10-3.fc20
URL: http://drupal.org/project/ctools

Please consult the package updates policy before you issue an update to a stable branch: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Updates_Policy

More information about the service that created this bug can be found at:
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Upstream_release_monitoring

drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.el6 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 6.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.el6

drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.fc20 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 20.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.fc20

drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.el5 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 5.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.el5

drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.fc19 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 19.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.fc19

Package drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.fc19:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora 19 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=updates-testing drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.fc19'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2014-2484/drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.fc19
then log in and leave karma (feedback).
drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.fc19 has been pushed to the Fedora 19 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

Access bypass issues were found in the Chaos tool suite (ctools) module. The upstream advisory https://drupal.org/node/2194589 states:

"Prior to this version, ctools did not sufficiently check access grants for various types of content other than nodes. It also didn't sufficiently check access before displaying content with the relationship plugin.

These vulnerabilities are mitigated by the fact that you must be using entities other than node or users for the autocomplete callback, or you must be using the relationship plugin and displaying the content (e.g. in panels)."

These have been resolved in versions 6.x-1.11 and 7.x-1.4:

https://drupal.org/node/2194547
https://drupal.org/node/2194551

Created drupal7-ctools tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1064866]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1064871]

Created drupal6-ctools tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1064865]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1064867]
drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.fc19 has been pushed to the Fedora 19 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal7-ctools-1.4-1.fc19 has been pushed to the Fedora 19 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal7-ctools-1.4-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal6-ctools-1.11-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal7-ctools-1.4-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal7-ctools-1.4-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
All ctools packages are in stable repositories. Can we close this issue?

Hi Peter,

Thanks for the quick fixes for these, and sorry for the slow reply.

The Security Response Team closes these ones (the ones filed against the "Security Response" Product).

Access bypass issues were found in the Chaos tool suite (ctools) module. The upstream advisory https://drupal.org/node/2194589 states:

"Prior to this version, ctools did not sufficiently check access grants for various types of content other than nodes. It also didn't sufficiently check access before displaying content with the relationship plugin.

These vulnerabilities are mitigated by the fact that you must be using entities other than node or users for the autocomplete callback, or you must be using the relationship plugin and displaying the content (e.g. in panels)."

These have been resolved in versions 6.x-1.11 and 7.x-1.4:

https://drupal.org/node/2194547
https://drupal.org/node/2194551

Created drupal7-ctools tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1064866]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1064871]

Created drupal6-ctools tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1064865]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1064867]

All ctools packages are in stable repositories. Can we close this issue?

Hi Peter,

Thanks for the quick fixes for these, and sorry for the slow reply.

The Security Response Team closes these ones (the ones filed against the "Security Response" Product).

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When creating a Bodhi update request, please use the bodhi submission link
noted in the next comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this
tracking bug as well as the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
Bodhi notes field when available.

Please note: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora.
Only one tracking bug has been filed; please ensure that it is only closed
when all affected versions are fixed.

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

Please use the following update submission link to create the Bodhi
request for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well
as this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get
updated when new packages are pushed to stable.

Please also ensure that the "Close bugs when update is stable" option
remains checked.

Bodhi update submission link:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/new/?type_=security&bugs=1064864,1064865
